SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AddStateModal
A dialog that allows the user to add a new state to the automaton.
AddStateModalBody
The body of the dialog that allows the user to add a new state to the automaton.
AddTransitionModal
A dialog that allows the user to add a new transition to the automaton.
AddTransitionModalBody
The body of the dialog that allows the user to add a new transition to the automaton.
Alerts
The Alerts class provides utility methods for displaying different types of alert dialogs.
Args
The Args class provides a collection of static methods for checking method parameters and throwing IllegalArgumentExceptions if the parameters do not meet the specified requirements.
AutomataSaver
 
BottomBar
BottomBar: contains a textfield to input words, buttons that control automata playback capabilities and a list of transitions.
Components
This class is used to gather the main components of the application.
Constants
Constants used in the application
Constants.Orientation
Orientations
Constants.PlayBackSpeed
Enums
Constants.PlayBackState
 
Constants.Theme
Themes
ContentZoomPane
Deprecated.
This class will be removed in the final stable 2.0.0 version in favor of ContentZoomScrollPane.
ContentZoomScrollPane
This class provides zooming and panning for any JavaFX Pane.
Digraph<V,E>
A directed graph (or digraph) is a graph that is made up of a set of vertices connected by edges, where the edges have a direction associated with them.
DigraphEdgeList<V,E>
Implementation of a digraph that adheres to the Digraph interface.
Dwmapi
The Dwmapi interface provides access to functions in the Dwmapi.dll library, which is used for Desktop Window Manager (DWM) composition.
Edge<E,V>
An edge connects two Vertex of type V and stores an element of type E.
ForceDirectedLayoutStrategy<V>
A representation of a force directed layout "strategy" used during automatic layout of nodes in a SmartGraphPanel.
ForceDirectedSpringGravityLayoutStrategy<V>
An implementation of a spring system layout strategy with gravity towards the center.
ForceDirectedSpringSystemLayoutStrategy<V>
An implementation of a spring system layout strategy.
FXWinUtil
The FXWinUtil class provides utility methods for working with Windows-specific features in JavaFX applications.
Graph<V,E>
A graph is made up of a set of vertices connected by edges, where the edges have no direction associated with them, i.e., they establish a two-way connection.
GraphEdgeList<V,E>
ADT Graph implementation that stores a collection of edges (and vertices) and where each edge contains the references for the vertices it connects.
GraphPanel
Panel in which Graph is displayed
GraphStatistics
 
InvalidEdgeException
Thrown when using an invalid edge in calls of methods in Graph and Digraph implementations.
InvalidVertexException
Thrown when using an invalid vertex in calls of methods in Graph and Digraph implementations.
LegendModalBody
The body of the dialog that shows the legend of the automaton.
Main
Runner class
MainPanel
The MainPanel class represents the main panel of the WordAutomata application.
Methods
Methods used in the application
Model
The `Model` class represents the model component of the Word Automata application.
PathFinder
 
SelectStateModal
A dialog that allows the user to select a state to view its details.
SelectTransitionModal
A dialog that allows the user to select a transition to view its details.
SetInitialStateModal
A dialog that allows the user to set the initial state of the automaton.
ShapeCircle
This class represents a circle shape with a specified radius.
ShapeFactory
A factory class for creating instances of shapes with a specified center coordinates and radius.
ShapeRegularPolygon
This class represents a regular polygon shape with a specified number of sides and radius.
ShapeStar
This class represents a five-point star shape inscribed within a specified radius.
ShapeWithRadius<T>
This interface represents a shape with a radius, providing methods to access and modify properties related to the center coordinates and radius of the shape.
SmartArrow
A shape of an arrow to be attached to a SmartGraphEdge.
SmartCircularSortedPlacementStrategy
Places vertices around a circle, ordered by the underlying vertices element.toString() value.
SmartGraphDemoContainer
A simple container that provides zoom and toggling of automatic layout of a SmartGraphPanel instance.
SmartGraphEdge<E,V>
A graph edge visually connects two Vertex of type V.
SmartGraphEdgeBase<E,V>
Used as a super-type for all different concrete edge implementations by SmartGraphPanel, e.g., line and curves.
SmartGraphEdgeCurve<E,V>
Concrete implementation of a curved edge.
SmartGraphEdgeLine<E,V>
Implementation of a straight line edge.
SmartGraphPanel<V,E>
JavaFX Pane that is capable of plotting a Graph or Digraph.
SmartGraphProperties
Properties used by SmartGraphPanel.
SmartGraphVertex<V>
Abstracts the internal representation and behavior of a visualized graph vertex.
SmartGraphVertexNode<T>
Internal implementation of a graph vertex for the SmartGraphPanel class.
SmartLabel
A label contains text and can be attached to any SmartLabelledNode.
SmartLabelledNode
A node to which a SmartLabel can be attached.
SmartLabelProvider<T>
A provider interface for generating labels.
SmartLabelSource
Method annotation to override an element's label provider.
SmartPlacementStrategy
Contains the method that should be implemented when creating new vertex placement strategies.
SmartRadiusProvider<T>
A provider interface for generating radii values.
SmartRadiusSource
Method annotation to override an element's vertex shape radius.
SmartRandomPlacementStrategy
Scatters the vertices randomly.
SmartShapeTypeProvider<T>
A provider interface for generating shape types.
SmartShapeTypeSource
Method annotation to override an element's vertex shape type representation.
SmartStylableNode
A stylable node can have its css properties changed at runtime.
SmartStyleProxy
This class acts as a proxy for styling of nodes.
State
Represents a state in a WordAutomata.
StateModal
A dialog that shows the details of a state.
StateModalBody
The body of the dialog that shows the details of a state.
StatisticsModalBody
The body of the dialog that shows the statistics of the automaton.
Transition
Represents a transition in a WordAutomata.
TransitionModal
A dialog that shows the details of a transition.
TransitionModalBody
The body of the dialog that shows the details of a transition.
TransitionWrapper
Represents a wrapper class for a transition in a word automaton, in order to store the starting and ending states of the transition.
UtilitiesBindings
Some Math operations implemented as bindings.
UtilitiesJavaFX
Utility methods for JavaFX.
UtilitiesPoint2D
Class with utility methods for Point2D instances.
Vertex<V>
A vertex contains an element of type V and is used both in graphs and digraphs.
WhyModal
 
WhyModalBody
 
WindowStyler
 
WordAutomata
The main class of the application.
